snippet: Elizabeth Warren defended her decision to identify herself as a minority years ago, saying she hoped it would help her "meet more people who had grown up like I had grown up."
abstract: Elizabeth Warren defended her decision to identify herself as a minority years ago, saying she hoped it would help her "meet more people who had grown up like I had grown up."

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and ABBY GOODNOUGH

headline.main: Warren Says She's Proud of Being American Indian
headline.print_headline: The Massachusetts Race: Defending a ‘Minority’ Label
